author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Madras High Court has vacated its interim stay restraining Neyveli Lignite Corporation (NLC) from deducting wages of its employees affiliated to CITU NLC Labour and Staff Union for allegedly going on strike despite a prohibitory order.

The issue pertains to a wage cut order passed by NLC management on November 3, deducting six days’ wages of the members affiliated to the two unions who participated in the strike from July 20 to August 27.

The order was assailed by the unions following which the High Court passed an interim order on November 27 restraining the NLC from deducting wages till further orders.

In a recent hearing, the NLC justified its order stating that the action was initiated since the workmen went on strike in spite of a prohibitory order issued by the court.

The employees had gone strike despite a prohibitory order
title: Stay on NLC pay cut for workers goes
